title.value: Surface water temperature observations and ice phenology estimations for 1.4 million lakes globally
title.justification: The title directly reflects the content of the paper, which focuses on global lake temperature and ice cover data.
title.quote:
Surface water temperature observations and ice phenology estimations for
1.4 million lakes globally

extractions.description: This paper discusses the creation of the LakeTEMP dataset, which includes surface water temperature and ice phenology data for 1.4 million lakes around the world. The dataset provides observational data and interpolated predictions of ice cover for lakes larger than 0.1 km2. The observations were derived from Landsat 8 satellite imagery and underwent validation and quality control procedures.

type.justification: The paper presents an empirical study as it involves data collection, validation, and analysis based on observations from the Landsat 8 satellite.
type.quote:
The surface water temperature of a lake is a crucial factor that affects
physical, ecological, and biogeochemical processes... Measurements of lake surface water temperature (LSWT) have long been gathered at individual lakes.

name.justification: The field is identified as Remote Sensing due to the use of the Landsat 8 satellite for collecting surface temperature data.
name.quote:
The Primary dataset was derived from
thermal wavelength bands 10 (10.60–11.19 μ m) and 11 (11.50–12.51
μ m) of the Landsat 8 top-of-atmosphere reflectance collection 1

name.justification: The study focuses on monitoring lake temperatures globally which falls under the umbrella of Environmental Monitoring.
name.quote:
Here, we present the LakeTEMP dataset, consisting of two separate
subsets termed “Primary” and “Aggregated”...

name.justification: The research involves processing spatial data for global analysis, aligning with GIS technologies.
name.quote: Lake shoreline polygons were converted to grid format...

name.justification: LakeTEMP is the primary dataset presented and utilized in the study, encompassing lake temperature observations and predictions.
name.quote: Here, we present the LakeTEMP dataset, consisting of two separate subsets termed “Primary” and “Aggregated”.

referenced_paper_title.value: Estimating the volume and age of water stored in global lakes using a geo-statistical approach
referenced_paper_title.justification: This referenced paper supports the dataset by providing underpinning parameters for lake characteristics.

name.justification: The library was used for processing the satellite data to extract temperature information.
name.quote: The Google Earth Engine platform was used to download the TIR imagery and to perform initial processing steps.

referenced_paper_title.value: Google Earth Engine: Planetary-scale geospatial analysis for everyone
referenced_paper_title.justification: The quoted study is a widely referenced paper describing the capabilities and uses of the Google Earth Engine.
